msContents.summary: An exchange of property between Patrikios, son of Ailianos, and Flavius Valens consisting of four pieces of grainland. After the plots have been exchanged, both parties engage to pay all the taxes for their new property. The document also refers to a land reassessment that took place under the ἐπόπτηϲ (Lat. censitor) Valerius.

msItemStruct.note: The reconstructed text contains 155 lines. The middle and end, written transversa charta, have been preserved in relatively good condition. The ﬁrst half has been mainly lost. Left margin extant (2.5 cm). At least three distinct hands appear the main hand being that of the notary public. The notary's script is fast, ﬂuid, and mostly cursive, with few orthographic errors. Patrikios' script is clear and carefully shaped mostly separately written letters are of average size. Valens' script is ﬂuid, swift, and mostly cursive.
